thread.title: Joao Sousa makes early exit from Kremlin Cup at hands of Daniel Gimeno-Traver
thread.title_full: Joao Sousa makes early exit from Kremlin Cup at hands of Daniel Gimeno-Traver

title: Joao Sousa makes early exit from Kremlin Cup at hands of Daniel Gimeno-Traver
text:
Joao Sousa makes early exit from Kremlin Cup at hands of Daniel Gimeno-Traver 19 Oct 2015 20:17:20 
comments 
Portuguese seventh seed Joao Sousa was a surprise early casualty in the first round of the Kremlin Cup in Moscow on Monday. 
The world number 45 was beaten by Spain's Daniel Gimeno-Traver, who needed two hours and 11 minutes to claim a 7-6 (7/2) 4-6 7-5 victory. 
Also in the men's event in Monday, Russian pair Andrey Kuznetsov and Teymuraz Gabashvili progressed with wins over Radu Albot and Cem Ilkel respectively. 
There was more home success in the women's event, where veteran Svetlana Kuznetsova beat Czech Katerina Siniakova 6-0 6-3 in 70 minutes. 
Ukraine's Lesia Tsurenko beat Aleksandra Krunic of Serbia 6-3 6-1 and there were also wins for Irina-Camelia Begu, Dominika Cibulkova and Margarita Gasparyan. Related Sport News
